item.title: Is it Wrong?
item.description:
Is it wrong that grown men should want to dress up in womans frocks and play a Stoolball game every year?

I’ll let you decide, but these photos might offend the light hearted amongst you

item.title: Microsoft .Net Frameworks
item.description:
The .NET Framework 3.0 adds new technologies to the .NET Framework 3.0, which makes the .NET Framework 3.0 a superset of the .NET Framework 2.0

surely there’s an easier way to say this! How about, “The .Net Framework 3.0 is the next version of .Net Framework”

item.title: May 4th
item.description: In tribute to Starwars, Hapy May 4th be with you Day!!

item.title: Styling the Flickr Badge
item.description: As I’m going around trying to smarten this place up, I ran into a problem with the Flickr Badge. First, It has a maximum of ten image thumbs. Second, even the small thumbnails are pretty big. Time to get out the coding equivilent of an axe.

item.title: Please excuse the mess
item.description: Between full-time work, part-time freelance, eating and sleeping, I haven’t had enough time to do any spring cleaing around here. So, updates to the styles and content is patchy at best, and downright crap for the rest of the time. What makes it even harder, is using way too many machines to try and do the changes. Which means that i’m currently coding this site in whatever tools i can get my hands on, including: notepad, textwrangler, dreamweaver, Skedit, Visual Studio 2005. Put simlpy, whatever is installed, or whatever is a free download! By the way, my favourite of editor is the brilliant Skedit, go check it out now.

item.title: &nbsp;
item.description: There was once a time when I could type this character combination without having to think too much about what order the ‘n’, ‘b’, ‘s’ and ‘p’ went. For those of you who don’t know this entity very well, it’s the non-breaking-space entity. It used to be the most overly used of all the entities, it was the web designers best friend. So why doesn’t anyone use them anymore?

item.title: New Desktops
item.description: Check out the new Desktops, free to download and do with as you please! I'll be adding more every month (hopefully!), so keep coming back. Subscribe to the journal RSS/Atom feeds for easy updates.

item.title: What happend to the Blue?
item.description: Put simply, i got a bit boarded of it. It was all getting too dark around here and as you might have noticed (or not), I've been doing some pretty big changes, all in full view of the masses. Which explains the green and red boxes (for CSS problem solving) all over the place, and why half the site doesn't work!

item.title: What Would Macgyver Do?
item.description:
If he was going to start a new web blog Journal, Well, he would probably construct some kind of clever machine that would be totally independant of human thought and be made out of matchsticks and double sided tape.

Well, i'm not Macgyver, so i'll just do what everyone else does and have a couple of webpages with all the navigation down the right hand side, and talk about topics like web design, typography, 42, and some other useless things that will clog up all your news readers.

Abit about me, I'm a struggling part-time designer, and after doing some pretty nice projects (i'll upload them soon) i needed somewhere to showcase them and explain what is was thinking at the time.
